alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... whether they be stellar interiors, interstellar plasma, pulsar magnetospheres, or intergalactic cosmic rays. The dangers of misconception is particularly great for distant astrophysical objects that will forever remain inaccessible to in situ observation. To avoid this danger, it is essential to utilize the empirical knowledge of plasma behavior that has been, and will continue to be, gathered from plasmas in the laboratory and accessible regions of space."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Peratt on Conjecture - Part 2
